result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Jevett Tooley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
*Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and fees by November 3, 2016, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
*Court ordered restitution set at $0 (zero).
Consecutive to: To Count 1 and any other sentence, with credit for 94 (ninety-four) days time served, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

records.addlTxt: -From defendant and businesses; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Sentencing proceeded. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:

Court sentences defendant to serve 94 days in the House of Correction with credit for 94 (ninety-four) days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

AS TO COUNT 2:

 The Court ordered defendant to serve 94 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 1 and any other sentence, with credit for 94 (ninety-four) days time served, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:

Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and fees by November 3, 2016, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.

Court ordered restitution set at $0 (zero).
 
Filed;
-Victim Impact Statement;
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Michael Jevett Tooley in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Defendant Michael Jevett Tooley in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.
-On behalf of the defendant; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Attorney Angele R. Dentice in court, defendant Michael Jevett Tooley not in court, in custody and not produced.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Status conference held off the record. Client wishes resolution and may not desire trial.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Angele R. Dentice in court, defendant Michael Jevett Tooley not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Case adjourned to Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Angele R. Dentice in court, defendant Michael Jevett Tooley not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Branch 45 for Branch 37.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Case remains scheduled for status conference on 8-20-2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 37.
Attorney Dentice contacted court to schedule a bail/bond hearing.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for 7-16-2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 45 for Branch 37.

Attorney Angele R. Dentice in court, defendant Michael Jevett Tooley not in court, in custody and not produced.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer, additional time to review.   Court ordered case adjourned for pre-trial conference in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Status conference scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael Jevett Tooley not in court, defendant in custody and not produced.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for pre-trial conference. Attorney Angele Dentice unavailable for today's proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing. 
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: Walgreens
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael Jevett Tooley in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Michael Jevett Tooley in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
